post_text:
As the staff will return to work in a few weeks, keep this in mind:

Please, please hear us....If your child is returning to the school setting to receive in- person instruction, the rules regarding masks CANNOT be a daily struggle for our drivers, teachers, and staff. It will need to be as normal as wearing shoes. This is not political on the part of anyone in leadership roles, but rather our due diligence in bringing hundreds of people together each day from hundreds of separate homes with varying degrees of risk and exposure. We want to get past this, too - and with 100% of our staff and students intact and healthy. Please help us by setting a tone in your home that removes some of the challenges that may be attached to mask protocols.
text:
As the staff will return to work in a few weeks, keep this in mind:

Please, please hear us....If your child is returning to the school setting to receive in- person instruction, the rules regarding masks CANNOT be a daily struggle for our drivers, teachers, and staff. It will need to be as normal as wearing shoes. This is not political on the part of anyone in leadership roles, but rather our due diligence in bringing hundreds of people together each day from hundreds of separate homes with varying degrees of risk and exposure. We want to get past this, too - and with 100% of our staff and students intact and healthy. Please help us by setting a tone in your home that removes some of the challenges that may be attached to mask protocols.

post_text:
Thank you to all of the administrators, teachers, and support staff who came out to be in the parade. Job Well Done!

A special thank you to Deputy Nisenboum for leading the way and allowing me to be his copilot/ grand marshal.

Thank you to all of the sheriff who came out and helped with the parade route. LCSO we appreciate you.

Thank you to the Sheffield Township Fire Department for joining us and bringing the fire truck.

Finally, thank you to all of the students, parents, and community members who stood out along the route to show your support. We appreciate you.
text:

A special thank you to Deputy Nisenboum for leading the way and allowing me to be his copilot/ grand marshal.

Thank you to all of the sheriff who came out and helped with the parade route. LCSO we appreciate you.

Thank you to the Sheffield Township Fire Department for joining us and bringing the fire truck.

Finally, thank you to all of the students, parents, and community members who stood out along the route to show your support. We appreciate you.

shared_text:
Clearview Clippers Athletics is feeling grateful at FirstEnergy Stadium.
November 10, 2019 at 3:06 PM · Cleveland, OH ·

Clearview Head Coach Mike Collier and Week 9 Game MVP Chase Christensen were honored on field at FirstEnergy Stadium during today's Browns vs. Bills game, along with winners from Week 8 (Mogadore) and Week 10 (Alliance).

Because Clearview defeated Black River in the Browns High School Game of the Week, the Cleveland Browns made a $2,500 donation to Clearview High School. Thank you Browns!

(Photo courtesy: Twitter/Browns Youth Football)

Speaker reminds Clearview teachers importance of relationships, technology

The Chronicle-Telegram
August 21, 2019 at 1:53 PM ·

"I tell people, you get to be a teacher," he said. "You don't have to be here ... I tell some people if you don't like kids, please find something else to do. And sometimes you need to remember your 'why,' you do."

post_text: We see some familiar faces in this post!
shared_text:
Lorain County Community College
August 7, 2019 at 11:45 AM ·

Volunteers are hard at work filling backpacks with school supplies as part of the “Give Back with Backpacks” program sponsored by Lorain County Prosecutor Dennis Will and LCCC. The program will provide backpacks and school supplies to every student in grades K-3 in the Clearview, Elyria and Lorain school districts.

The supplies were purchased with money seized from drug dealers and forfeited to the Lorain County Prosecutor’s Office. Backpacks will be delivered to the school districts and be available to children on the first day of school. ✏️ 📖

#LCCCProud
Lorain County Prosecutor Dennis Will

shared_text:
Durling PTO
June 14, 2019 at 11:29 AM ·

Summer reading has begun at Durling and Vincent! I know some of you no longer have kids in school (😞), but I need as many parents as possible to see this. ***Kids who don’t read for 3 months lose 3 months of growth from last year!*** Teachers will be available at both schools to help with both reading and math. We will help students pick out books, read with them and help with am. Parents are welcome to stay as well.

post_text: UPDATED BUS DEPARTURE TIME 2:30pm, NOT 3:00pm. Parents, students and community members are encouraged to gather on Broadway from North Ridge to Cooper Foster on Saturday afternoon at 2:30 pm to send off the varsity football team as they depart to their round two playoff game in Wooster. All available Sheffield Township Fire & EMS vehicles will be escorting the buses from the school to the highway. Show your Clipper pride and wish the team good luck.
shared_text:

UPDATED BUS DEPARTURE TIME 2:30pm, NOT 3:00pm. Parents, students and community members are encouraged to gather on Broadway from North Ridge to Cooper Foster on Saturday afternoon at 2:30 pm to send off the varsity football team as they depart to their round two playoff game in Wooster. All available Sheffield Township Fire & EMS vehicles will be escorting the buses from the school to the highway. Show your Clipper pride and wish the team good luck.

shared_text:
NAPT.ORG
www.napt.org

Educational Service Center of Lorain County
October 22, 2018 at 9:33 PM ·

This week (Oct. 22-26) is National School Bus Safety Week. Thank you bus drivers, aides, mechanics, and supervisors for keeping our students safe. School bus transportation plays a critical role in the education of our nation's students, and is the direct link between a neighborhood and the classroom. More than 25 million children ride the yellow bus every school day, and National School Bus Safety Week serves as a reminder for students, parents, teachers, and the community to keep school bus safety in the forefront. Here are tips to keep our children safe at the bus stop.

https://www.napt.org/files/NSBSW/Bus%20Stop%20Safety%20Tips-2016update.pdf?fbclid=IwAR1tQYoybqAnWY6D1ErhMk97gZ9duY12qh1N-aVnY4Uec5PgOr_zYWUG4Yo

October 15, 2018 at 7:30 AM ·

ThomCat Photography
October 8, 2018 at 12:29 PM ·

The Clearview High Clipper Football Team was recognized on the 50th Anniversary of their 1968 Lakeland Conference Football Championship at the Homecoming Game this past Friday. Great to see the guys again as well as Coaches Phil Sheffield and Bob Walsh.

Here is a pic of the team that I am proud to say I was a part of. Can you find me?
